title: The problem with Yasuo is that he completely owns the lane.
body:
Everything that happens in the lane is completely in his control. He can clear waves extremely fast with his E + Q for no cost (resourceless), but can freeze just as easily. He can get to almost any location in the lane nearly instantly because of his dash that has basically no cooldown, if you're not under your tower or in the side bush then regardless of where you are you're basically in melee range as far as Yasuo is concerned. He automatically wins short trades with his passive shield + windwall, and wins long trades with his short cooldowns and sustained damage. It's extremely hard to poke him since he's zooming around left and right constantly, and even if you do manage to hit him his passive shield will negate all the damage, and it recharges very quickly. Once he gets his ult you can't be aggressive in lane, you have to sit like a little bitch under your tower because if you get anywhere near your minions then he's just going to dash up into your face, ult you, and then crit you a few hundred thousand times. His abilities have extremely short cooldowns, so he can spam all of his abilities as much as he wants and you can't exploit that because he's resourceless and his abilities are always up.

The part that bothers me most is that for the overwhelming majority of matchups, if you ever kill Yasuo in lane, it's because he fucked up, not because you outplayed him.

You're missing the point.  

Yasuo is more dependent on team comp and his enemy's behavior than anything else.  The right team comp or a bunch of smart players will make even a good Yasuo cry.  

A 40 CS lead isn't the same as being up 2 kills on your opponent.  Kills mean more in Patch 5.22 than they did in the past and making that comparison is much more complex than you let on.  If you let Yasuo kill you in lane twice then you are giving him a chance to deny you gold and experience while also giving him the gold and experience worth of 2 kills.  That's a hell of a lot worse than being down 40 CS.  To give you some context; when I see a teammate feed multiple kills to secure farm early game I know they're a noob, but when I see a teammate sacrifice that farm to stay alive I know they're a smart player and our chances of winning that game just skyrocketed.  The WORST thing you can do is give your opponent gold and experience, ESPECIALLY if they're a very snowbally champion like Yasuo or Riven.

2 kills is worth 40 CS. I honestly doubt this early in the game Yasuo is gonna be getting any shut down gold from kills. Thinking as kills as the standard 300 gold (which is still is unless someone is uber fed) means 40 CS translate to more or less two kills ahead of someone.

Yasuo is already denying you gold and exp by constantly pushing you under tower anyways and forcing you to back because you can't sustain through the lane getting poked and trying to CS under tower.

2 kills is worth way more than 40 cs. Yeah the "gold" is about the same but the fact that he doesn't have to leave lane and can get a cs lead ON TOP of the kills and get at least a level or two ahead of you makes all of the difference. Also if it was an easy 100-0 kill he can easily roam afterwards and just make more money since the map currently is a 4v5 while you are staring at a grey screen.

Some  thoughts on yasuo from a yasuo main

1) yasuo is really good against mages or champions who are really projectile heavy, but he gets crushed by other melee champs with higher base stats like zed or pantheon, also champs like riven or darius, mundo, anyone who can just flex on him, that's because yasuo is tuned around his windwall and Es power to dodge and deflect projectiles, so if you're playing a champ who doesn't rely on them he'll be significantly weaker

2) while counterpicks are nice not everyone plays draft mode and I believe hard counters are a bad thing and a truly balanced champion is one everyone has a chance to play with. 

3) yasuo has 2 problems right now regarding balance, the 1st is obvious, 100% crit chance at 2 items (shiv and cloak) which I do think needs to be addressed 

4) yasuo has a conflict of identity that he shares with vayne, jax, and kassadin, they're all champions who are designated as "powerful late game carries" while also either being strong duelists or counterpicks, this leads to then just feeling strong at all stages in the game. This is the 2nd issue and much harder to address.

5) I think the best solution, although site is 3 changes that doesn't make yasuo feel any less fun to play (which is important to me) but makes him much more manageable 

-a change to his passive, he should get 100% crit after 3 big items, not 2.

-a change to his Q make the duration for his knockup charge 5 seconds (down from 10) they did a similar change to twisted fates gold card awhile back to tone down his lane pressure, and considering yasuos Q is on a 4ish second cooldown, it gives yasuo a 1 second window to trade with his knockup  (where his opponent will trade poorly)

-a change to windwall, this is honestly I think the biggest nerf here but one I feel is necessary for yasuo to not feel so bs, make windwall start outside of yasuo and not inside of him, windwall starts inside yasuo and doesn't actually appear until it's a few units past him, this is how yasuos block spells last second, sometimes without even casting it in the right direction 

These will tone down his early game power significantly without feeling as awful as say a 5 second cooldown on E, yasuo is a fun champ and I do believe he should be strong late game But he's currently pretty overbearing in lane right now.

Your suggestion to change his knockup charge to a shorter duration is something I can't believe I never thought of. It's just like what they did to Ryze's passive stack duration; Having to wait for a window of opportunity to go in every 10+ seconds is NOT fun, especially when Ryze is standing a comfortable distance away because of his range. The same goes for Yasuo; If he sees a chance within 10 seconds, he'll just dash into you. If not, he can stay back 'till the next wave comes to repeat the process all over again. 

The problem with these 10 second windows is that they have INSANE control over the lane. 
Got your stacks ready? Last hit minions. 
Chance to go in? Do it; You have the means to pull it off (Ryze R, Yasuo E). 
Getting ganked? Chances are, your stacks are STILL up, so you can either 2v1 because you're at your most powerful, or use whatever is at your disposal to escape.

Now that they nerfed Ryze's stack duration, his grip over the lane has been loosened CONSIDERABLY; He's always needed enough mana to sustain his combo, but now he has to burn through more of it to keep stack pressure over the lane. Yasuo doesn't need to worry about mana, so a completely reasonable nerf would be lowering his knockup charge duration like you suggested.

Beyond that, there's things beyond his control - like the Jungler. Yeah, he can hold onto that wall, and he may block your ult. But you know what he can't do shit about? That jungler that just came in uninvited to the party that he didn't know about because wards are magical, but they're not omnipresent and he can't predict what route the enemy jungler will come from 100% of the time. And so on. 

The whole lane is not decided by Yasuo. There's two people in a lane, minimum (barring disconnections and server issues); it takes two to tango and sometimes Yasuo doesn't get to lead.
